panels.description:
Average Jenkins Health Score over the time (%) in the defined interval.

Score based on healthy disk space, failed plugins, healthy temporary space, and thread deadlocks.
panels.title: Jenkins Health Score

panels.description: Sum of Number of Failed Plugins. A value other than 0 is typically indicative of a potential issue within the Jenkins installation that will either be solved by explicitly disabling the plugin(s) or by resolving the plugin dependency issues.
panels.title: Plugins Failed

panels.description: The 99% percentile of HTTP Requests handled by Jenkins masters.
panels.title: HTTP Request Duration (99%)

panels.description: The ratio of ok (200) request out of all requests.
panels.title: Good HTTP Request Ratio

panels.description:
Comparison of build completion status' within specified time interval.

Success: The Build has no errors, and completed.

Failure: The Build had a fatal error, and did not complete.

Aborted: The Build was interrupted before it reaches its expected end. For example, the user has stopped it manually or there was a time-out.

Unstable: The Build had some errors but they were not fatal. The build completed.

Not Built: The Build was scheduled but cancelled and not started. This could be due to manual intervention or concurrent builds are not allowed.
panels.title: Build Completion Status

panels.description: Average time spent in the queue.
panels.title: Average Queue Time

panels.description:
Average time spent in the building.

Build: Total time spent executing the build.

Total: Time spent in the queue as well as completing the build.
panels.title: Average Build Time

panels.description: Rate (5m range)  at which jobs are built and the time they spend building per 1 hour (Meter).
panels.title: Building Rate (Jobs/1h)

panels.description: Graph of available executors vs in use
panels.title: Executor Efficiency
